ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
What is your overall rating of the primary instructor?
The primary instructor's sensitivity to students and ability to provide students with adequate feedback was:

narratives.question_text: Indicate the total number of hours per week (outside the classroom) you spent on this course:
comments: Less work than typical, but a fair amount given amount of background reading necessary if unfamiliar with biology
Approximately an hour or two per week, which increased significantly during my presentation week and during midterm/exam weeks

narratives.question_text: Looking back on this course, what is your overall assessment of the course:  What are its strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might it be improved?
comments: Please, please, please in the future inform students that a solid understanding of genetics is required to benefit from this course. Perhaps it should even be a prerequisite. Having no prior coursework in genetics, I felt like large portions of the class were being taught in a different language. I did benefit from my prior coursework in epidemiology and toxicology, but struggled keep up with the large genetic component of this class.
Great overview of molecular methods. Perhaps references to textbook might be useful, although is difficult in a rapidly changing field.
The breadth of material was quite large. It might be better to narrow the scope and cover it in more depth.
Good introduction to molecular epi, but requires a good deal of scientific background knowledge.
Material was interesting and relevant to current molecular epi research. Lecture slides were a bit disorganized.

narratives.question_text: Please evaluate the instructor of this course. What are the instructor's strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might his or her teaching be improved?
comments: Instructor: Herbert Yu  Dr. Yu was very friendly to students and happy to answer questions. Sometimes we were a little rushed on the slides and did not get to fully cover everything.
Instructor: Herbert Yu  Dr. Yu was a wonderful professor and always available to answer questions outside of class. I learned a great deal from him.

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize this course for a fellow student? Would you recommend it to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Advanced concepts in genetics and molecular changes associated with chronic disease. Very interesting but requiring a solid foundation in epidemiology and genetics to truly engage with and benefit from the course material.
This course is a general overview of molecular epi and I would recommend it to someone who wants to familiarize themselves with this subject area.

Good class, interesting material, make sure to take good notes so that you can make sense of the slides when you are studying them later on because they are a bit disorganized and difficult to follow at times.
